div.p: Constellation Schools provides every child an opportunity to obtain an excellent education built on a foundation of character education for life long success.

p.span: Please click the following link to view weekly updates, assignments, and other information provided by your teachers. There's also access to a virtual career fair.

strong.span:
Call Center for COVID-19/Coronavirus
Ohio Department of Health
1-833-4-ASK-ODH
strong.br:
Open seven days a week from 9:00 AM - 8:00 PM
For the general public regarding questions about Coronavirus
Cuyahoga County established a helpline for residents who have general questions about Coronavirus. This helpline is in addition to the Ohio Department of Health's call center.

strong.span:
COVID CareLine for Mental Health Support
Ohio Department of Mental Health and Addiction Services
1-800-720-9616
strong.br:
Open seven days a week from 8:00 AM - 8:00 PM
This toll-free, confidential careline provides emotional support to individuals who may be struggling to cope with current challenges in their lives.

br.span: Please click the following link to view resources provided by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention and the Ohio Department of Health regarding the Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19), including multilingual resources.
Please click the following link to view information and resources provided by Constellation Schools to assist your family during the school closure.

div.h1: From the Desk of Principal Kaiser...

img.title: Cherie Kaiser, Principal
img.style: width: 23%; height: 31%; float: right; margin-top: 5px; margin-left: 7px;

p.img: Thank you for taking an interest in Constellation Schools: Old Brooklyn Community Elementary (OBCE).

div.p: I am honored to have the role of principal at OBCE since its inception back in 1998. Since our humble beginning, our commitment to high standards in education has not wavered. We remain devoted to educating students in an environment that is based on mutual respect and Character Education.

Constellation Schools: Old Brooklyn Community Elementary is a pillar in the Old Brooklyn neighborhood of Cleveland. Our small classroom size, outstanding teachers and the parental support within our school contributes to our success.

Our educational philosophy is based on the belief that every student is an individual and has the potential to learn in an environment that is safe and based on mutual respect. Differentiated instruction is provided to ensure that each child is successful and prepared to meet the demands of the 21st century.
If you would like to learn more about Constellation Schools: Old Brooklyn Community Elementary, please contact the school office at 216-661-7888 to schedule a school tour.

br.h1: From the Desk of Assistant Principal Scott...

img.title: Kristina Scott, Assistant Principal
img.style: width: 21%; height: 31%; float: right; margin-top: 5px; margin-left: 7px;

br.p: Welcome to Constellation Schools: Old Brooklyn Community Middle (OBCM). As part of the Constellation Schools Consortium, OBCM strives to provide an excellent education for our students built on a foundation of Character Education. We believe that each and every child deserves the opportunity to learn in a safe and nurturing environment with staff that can help them to achieve personal success.

Our middle school program has a strong focus on academic achievement. Teachers provide data driven instruction which enables them to ensure that the students are mastering the essential skills and concepts. Individualized or small group instruction is provided to students to help enhance instruction.

As a compliment to our focus on academics, OBCM students have the opportunity to participate in student leadership activities to help them grow into strong citizens of their community. Community Clean Up Days, Food and Clothing Drives, and Letter Writing Campaigns are just a few of the ways that our students have reached out to those in need.

Constellation Schools: Old Brooklyn Community Middle serves students in grades 5-8. It shares a campus with Old Brooklyn Community Elementary which serves grades K-4. We work closely together to educate our students in a cooperative and respectful environment with strong parental support and participation. We truly believe that we truly are “The Right Choice for Parents and a Real Chance for Children” of the Old Brooklyn community.

p.br: SaferOH tip line will allow students and adults to anonymously share information with school officials and law enforcement about threats to student safety - whether that involved threatened mass incident or harm of a single student.

div.p: Constellation Schools: Old Brooklyn Community Middle does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, disability, or age in its programs and activities and provides equal access to the Boy Scouts and other designated youth groups. The following person has been designated to handle inquiries regarding non-discrimination policies:
